item.title: 美国芯片法案办公室因特朗普大清洗损失五分之二员工
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，随着唐纳德-特朗普总统削减联邦工作人员，负责一项价值 520 亿美元的芯片补贴计划的美国政府办公室将失去约五分之二的工作人员。【原文：The US government office responsible for a marquee $52 billion chip subsidy program will lose about two-fifths of its staff as President Donald Trump slashes the federal workforce, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 顶级航母警告：美国对中国船只收费可能导致成本激增
item.description: 全球最大远洋运输公司的负责人警告说，如果美国对中国建造的船只和拥有这些船只的公司征收费用，可能会使集装箱运价上涨 25%。【原文：The head of the world’s biggest ocean carrier warned that proposed US fees on Chinese-built ships and the companies that own them could raise container rates by 25% if imposed.】

item.title: 富时罗素允许欧元和美元股票加入英国指数
item.description: 指数提供商富时罗素（FTSE Russell）将允许以欧元和美元交易的股票加入英国的主要基准，此举有助于吸引股票在伦敦上市。【原文：Index provider FTSE Russell will let stocks that trade in euros and US dollars join major UK benchmarks, in a move that could help attract listings to London.】

item.title: 特朗普称将于 4 月 2 日开始对农产品进口征收关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，美国将从 4 月 2 日起对 "外部 "农产品征收关税，这是他对进口商品设置贸易壁垒的最新威胁。【原文：President Donald Trump said the US would impose tariffs on “external” agricultural products starting on April 2, his latest threat to impose trade barriers on imported goods.】

item.title: 特朗普调查外国进口木材，木材价格创 2022 年新高
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统下令对运往美国的木材进行调查后，木材期货升至两年半以来的最高点。【原文：Lumber futures rose to the highest in more than two and a half years after President Donald Trump ordered an investigation into shipments of the commodity into the US.】

item.title: 欧佩克+将在特朗普压力下开始拖延已久的增加供应行动
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）要求降低油价的压力下，"欧佩克+"（OPEC+）在一再推迟后将继续执行恢复石油停产的计划。原油跌幅扩大。【原文：OPEC+ will proceed with plans to revive halted oil production after repeated delays, amid pressure from President Donald Trump to lower oil prices. Crude extended losses.】

item.title: 特朗普关税临近，美国汽车制造商面临信贷压力
item.description: 债券投资者越来越担心汽车制造商的前景，因为美国关税可能会打击他们的底线。【原文：Bond investors are getting a little more concerned about the outlook for automakers that could see their bottom lines hit by US tariffs.】

item.title: 费森尤斯寻求 11 亿欧元收购透析公司股份
item.description: 费森尤斯公司正在寻求通过出售费森尤斯医疗用品公司（Fresenius Medical Care AG）的股票以及与这家透析公司相关的可交换债券筹集约 11 亿欧元（12 亿美元）的资金，以削减债务并重新分配资本。【原文：Fresenius SE is seeking to raise about €1.1 billion ($1.2 billion) in a sale of shares in Fresenius Medical Care AG as well as exchangeable bonds linked to the dialysis firm, as it looks to cut debt and reallocate capital.】

item.title: 风险偏好助推债券市场迎来 2020 年以来最好的二月
item.description: 2 月份，市政债券市场表现异常强劲，但随着新债券销售的增加，该资产类别正面临逆风。【原文：The muni market notched an unusually strong month in February — but the asset class is facing headwinds as new bond sales build.】

item.title: 调查显示：银行家认为欧洲首次公开募股在缓慢起步后正在加速
item.description: 根据 IPO 咨询公司 Queens Lane 对股权资本市场银行家的调查，欧洲的首次公开募股市场在缓慢起步后，有望在德国上市的带动下于今年晚些时候加速发展。【原文：Europe’s initial public offering market is expected to accelerate later in the year after a slow start, led by German listings, according to survey of equity capital market bankers by IPO advisory firm Queens Lane.】

item.title: 穆萨莱姆称美联储目标冲突时通胀预期是关键
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆说，虽然他预计物价增长将朝着央行2%的目标放缓，但决策者必须控制通胀预期。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said that while he anticipates price growth to moderate toward the central bank’s 2% goal, it is vital for policymakers to keep inflation expectations in check.】

item.title: 欧盟就银行交易规则进行民意调查，提供调整规则的选项
item.description: 据彭博新闻社看到的一份文件显示，欧盟计划就银行交易业务监管改革进行的民意调查将列出各种方案，包括提供长达三年的优惠。【原文：The European Union’s planned poll about regulatory changes for banks’ trading businesses will outline various options including offering concessions for as much as three years, according to a document seen by Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 欧洲需要一个 DOGE"：电信首席执行官怒斥欧盟官僚主义
item.description: 欧洲电信业高管齐聚欧洲大陆最大的贸易展，抨击过度监管，指责布鲁塞尔阻碍了该行业的整合，使其落后于美国和亚洲的同行。【原文：European telecommunications executives gathered at the continent’s biggest trade show railed against over-regulation, blaming Brussels for preventing consolidation in the industry that’s fallen behind peers in the US and Asia.】

item.title: 零日期权在特朗普动荡和 Robinhood 推动下创下交易纪录
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）诱发波动的政策议程和 Robinhood Markets 公司扩大产品范围的推动下，华尔街最受欢迎的期权交易之一变得比以往任何时候都更受欢迎。【原文：One of Wall Street’s most-popular option trades just got more popular than ever, fueled by Donald Trump’s volatility-inducing policy agenda and a push by Robinhood Markets Inc. to expand its product offerings.】

item.title: 欧盟考虑资助中东部国家在乌克兰储存天然气
item.description: 欧盟正在考虑资助中东国家明年冬季在乌克兰储存天然气。【原文：The European Union is considering helping finance central-east nations to store natural gas in Ukraine next winter.】

item.title: 欧佩克石油产量在计划恢复前升至一年新高
item.description: 在欧佩克计划恢复供应之前，受伊拉克、委内瑞拉和阿拉伯联合酋长国产量增加的推动，欧佩克的原油产量升至一年多来的最高水平。【原文：OPEC’s crude production rose to the highest level in more than a year ahead of the group’s planned supply revival, driven by gains in Iraq, Venezuela and the United Arab Emirates.】

item.title: 达纳-怀特的 Power Slap 与加密货币公司签订赞助协议
item.description: 达纳-怀特（Dana White）的 Power Slap 是一个新成立的掌掴组织，已与区块链网络 VeChain 签订了赞助协议。【原文：Dana White’s Power Slap, an upstart slap-fighting organization, has signed a sponsorship deal with blockchain network VeChain.】

item.title: Anthropic 以 615 亿美元估值完成巨额收购
item.description:
据说今年到目前为止，该公司的运营收入增加了 30%。【原文：

The company is said to have increased its run-rate revenue by 30% so far this year.

】

item.title: 加拿大帝国商业银行（CIBC）称，对美国贸易的信任已荡然无存，股市很脆弱
item.description: 加拿大帝国商业银行（Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce）分析师表示，随着美国迈向特朗普政府设定的关税最后期限，贸易风险将在未来几周主导金融市场。【原文：Trade risks are set to dominate financial markets in the coming weeks as the US heads toward tariff deadlines set by the Trump administration, according to analysts at Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce.】

item.title: 美国乙醇巨头在首席执行官下台后面临出售可能
item.description: 托德-贝克尔（Todd Becker）就任美国最大的乙醇生产商之一绿原公司（Green Plains Inc.【原文：When Todd Becker took the top job at Green Plains Inc., one of the US’s largest ethanol producers, it was 2009 and the nation had just announced an expansion of its biofuels mandate two years earlier.】

item.title: 南非与安赛乐米塔尔谈判保留长钢产能
item.description: 南非表示，在与政府的救援谈判失败和经营环境恶化之后，南非正在与安赛乐米塔尔南非有限公司进行谈判，以避免该国关键钢厂的关闭计划。【原文：South Africa said it is in talks with ArcelorMittal South Africa Ltd. to avert plans to shut crucial steel mills in the country after rescue talks with the government failed and the operating environment deteriorated.】

item.title: 奥特曼与马斯克是科技界最大的恩怨。什么是牛肉？
item.description:
OpenAI首席执行官多年前就与这位世界首富闹翻了。现在，马斯克正试图挫败奥特曼对领先人工智能平台的计划。【原文：

The OpenAI CEO fell out with the world’s richest man years ago. Now Musk is trying to thwart Altman’s plans for the leading AI platform.

】

item.title: 制造业数据引发对美国经济增长的担忧，国债走高
item.description: 周一，美国国债多数上涨，在美国制造业数据疲软引发投资者对经济增长放缓的忧虑后，五年期国债收益率一度跌破 4%。【原文：US Treasuries are mostly rising on Monday, briefly sending five-year yields below 4% after weakness in US manufacturing data fanned investor angst about slowing growth.】

item.title: 巴西首位奥斯卡奖得主在博尔索纳罗的调查中触动政治神经
item.description: 周日晚，当电影《我还在这里》成为巴西历史上第一位奥斯卡奖得主时，巴西爆发了。【原文：Brazil erupted Sunday night when the movie I’m Still Here became the first Oscar winner in the country’s history — in the middle of national Carnival celebrations, no less.】

item.title: 全球制造业连续第二个月扩张，投入成本上升
item.description: 受新订单自 2022 年以来最强劲增长的推动，2 月份全球工厂活动出现了八个月来最大幅度的扩张，这表明制造业正在企稳。【原文：Global factory activity expanded in February by the most in eight months, fueled by the strongest growth in new orders since 2022 and indicating manufacturing is stabilizing.】

item.title: 回购、并购可能助推欧洲大宗交易激增
item.description: 随着企业寻求为收购筹集资金并向股东返还现金，今年欧洲大宗交易的火爆开局预计将进一步扩大。【原文：The year’s blistering start for European block trades is expected to widen out as corporations look to raise funding for acquisitions and to return cash to shareholders.】

item.title: 巴尔离开美联储监管小组
item.description: 前美联储负责监管事务的副主席迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）已退出美国中央银行内部管理委员会监管委员会，使该委员会失去了主席。【原文：Former Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michael Barr has stepped off the US central bank’s internal governing Committee on Supervision and Regulation, leaving the panel without a chair.】

item.title: 伊拉克与石油公司的谈判受阻，库尔德斯坦石油出口推迟
item.description: 伊拉克和在该国库尔德斯坦半自治地区运营的石油公司在周日举行的一次会议上未能达成协议，该会议旨在帮助重启北部地区的原油出口。【原文：Iraq and oil companies operating in the country’s semi-autonomous Kurdistan failed to reach an agreement during a meeting on Sunday meant to help restart crude oil exports from the northern region.】

item.title: 台积电准备宣布投资 1000 亿美元兴建美国工厂
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，台湾半导体制造股份有限公司计划在未来四年内向美国的芯片工厂投资 1000 亿美元，唐纳德-特朗普总统将于周一晚些时候在白宫宣布这一举措。【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. plans to invest $100 billion in chips plants in the US over the next four years, a move President Donald Trump is set to announce at the White House later Monday, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 马斯克再次声称美联储 "荒谬地超员
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周日在 X 上发帖抨击美联储，称美国央行 "荒唐地人浮于事"。【原文：Elon Musk took aim at the Federal Reserve in a post on X Sunday, calling the US central bank “absurdly overstaffed.”】
